item.title: I fucking hate all exchanges who do XBT instead of BTC. Wish I could just add the exchange format ending (-USDT, USDT. _USDT, USDTM) without having this crap

item.title: R to @quant_arb: This is very specific to HFT. Otherwise just aggregate some Tardis quote data into midprice bars and call it a day.
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description: This is very specific to HFT. Otherwise just aggregate some Tardis quote data into midprice bars and call it a day.

item.title: Tardis is great but the best data is your own data. Only that data has the latency information that is important for HFT analysis. Otherwise you kinda just have to assume latency and hope it's a reasonable guess (often wrong conditional on wanting to trade - ie spikes when trade)
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description:
Tardis is great but the best data is your own data. Only that data has the latency information that is important for HFT analysis. Otherwise you kinda just have to assume latency and hope it's a reasonable guess (often wrong conditional on wanting to trade - ie spikes when trade)

item.title: R to @quant_arb: like a lot of it isn't in the docs. especially for options. Have to just memorize the names or find them in my emails.

item.title:
pro tip:
there's a load of data on Tardis that isn't in the docs.
kucoin-futures, and a load of options data (2 different names for binance options for some reason), etc

item.title:
If you’re a guy in your early 20s, buy a H100 GPU
Go into debt if you have to
This is not satire.
You can get an H100 for 30 grand
Having this much compute communicates status to women and business relationships

item.title:
RT by @quant_arb: Enough is enough. Ive been baited on this fine Sunday to put this bullshit to bed once and for all.
There's only 3 independent observations here, might as well use 1min data to make the R^2 even higher.
Here's how it looks with Bloomie data as a sanity check - close enough
Now lets look at 1 year fwd returns: wats the R^2 now bucko? (still a chart crime)
Here it is with 9 more years of data, with ONE observation per non-overlapping data point as they teach you in stat101:
0 points for Gryffindor and may god have mercy on your soul
item.dc:creator: @skyquake_1
item.description:
Enough is enough.
Ive been baited on this fine Sunday to put this bullshit to bed once and for all.

There's only 3 independent observations here, might as well use 1min data to make the R^2 even higher.

Here's how it looks with Bloomie data as a sanity check - close enough

Now lets look at 1 year fwd returns: wats the R^2 now bucko? (still a chart crime)

Here it is with 9 more years of data, with ONE observation per non-overlapping data point as they teach you in stat101:

0 points for Gryffindor and may god have mercy on your soul

item.title: 90% of the return period in each of these data points overlaps with another. Not very independent, and generally misleading
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
